```
zero.example.com { # set url, and then auto obtain tls cert

        basicauth / user pass # applies a auth popup to / with user and pass

        proxy / 192.168.0.115:43110 { # proxies that ip to /
                websocket # proxies websockets
        }

For example, whitelisting cloudflare rocket.js? 


This way a user must WANT to allow that js to load, it would be handy for cloudflare protected nodes to increase their speed,

@filips123 he basically explained it, Zeronet has Script Injection protection and breaks itself instead of breaking itself and showing an error along the lines of `Script injection detected from https://externet.clearnet.com/script.js`

Maybe we could patch the js? See if it works using a webserver software and
embed the new js? If I understood how it worked in the first place

topic.title: Multiple IP connections?
topic.body:
So basically, i found the `ui_ip` config 
Like. Holly hell the docs have LITTERALLY NEXT TO NOTHING ON THE CONFIG FILE

But i want to beable to access the service from both of these IP's,

`192.168.0.103`, which is the LAN ip (reserved) for the host machine
`127.0.0.1`, Self explanitory

but i can only ever get it to work on ONE of those connections.

Current config
```
[global]
ui_ip = 192.168.0.103
```

# edit:
Also, how would one do a reverse proxy? I tried to do something like that, and the system gave me the login screen (that plugin) and accepted my `ui_password` config, but then gave me this
```
Forbidden
Invalid host: zeronet.example.com
```

topic.body:

`./zeronet.py --data-dir /home/merith/.0data`
?

topic.title: WebZite to backup User.Json?
topic.body:
To put it simply, someone had a AMAZING idea on how to backup user.json files
http://talk.zeronetwork.bit/?Topic:1564523508_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKzqW6F8#comment_165_17zoTjVZEBUdo6uAvQvtbih7ibBMHQRsrH
^^^ RElated where the idea sparked from

Basically, we can upload our `user.json` in a encrypted manor, and have it seeded to everyone who does this, making it secure in the way that everything is encrypted, 

related to #2076

topic.title: Issues with Cloudflare
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: ZeroNet 0.7.1 r4206
  * Operating system: Archlinux
  * Web browser: Chrome
  * Tor status: not available
  * Opened port: yes
  * Special configuration: Caddy Server for reverse proxy to clearnet, `basicauth` directive. (Cloudflare security enabled < this is causing the issue)

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
```
Refused to load the script 'https://ajax.cloudflare.com/cdn-cgi/scripts/95c75768/cloudflare-static/rocket-loader.min.js' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "script-src 'nonce-Qd2I5FAUfeZSSfs2E2XG48a53uvX7XfBglJX2BV4irEaeRguliiljfDHTGAcsy9F'". Note that 'script-src-elem' was not explicitly set, so 'script-src' is used as a fallback.
```
I even disabled NoScript to see if it was an issue, same error without NoScript

#### Steps to reproduce:
Make a Clearnet node,
put said node behind Cloudflare and use their IP Protection proxy
It appears to be random 

#### Observed Results:
https://i.imgur.com/2rhdH20.png
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10422110/68520790-909b7300-024f-11ea-8a2b-0af55254f857.png)

https://i.imgur.com/5s8ywiz.png
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10422110/68520845-10294200-0250-11ea-9617-4d350ecba4c4.png)


#### Expected Results:
* Expected to load page normally

#### My Guess?
* Zeronet has some external js injection protection? if so, how do i whitelist cloudflare?

topic.title: [IDEA] access `.onion` urls
topic.body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**
So since Tor is integrated with Zeronet, i was thinking that we could simply add a proxy settings (reverse proxy with the webserver software where the 'header's are set to the actual `.onion` address?)

where you can access a `.onion` address with something like 
`127.0.0.1:43110/tors/www.facebookcorewwwi.onion` for HTTPS and
`127.0.0.1:43110/tor/www.facebookcorewwwi.onion` for HTTP

yes i used facebooks onion address as an example
